I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was the title of the French film that became "Too Beautiful to be True", a parody on itself and on those other French films like "Un Aquarium pour Amour" (1999), that were nothing but ripoffs of "Les Valseuses".

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form a posse to destroy the beast that is killing their livestock.
